Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, friendly hotel, very close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: JoyArcher
Reviews.Content: I stayed this Easter and was not disappointed. The rooms are very clean, and the lovely garden is a bonus. I don't know why people complain about the lack of free WiFi: the terms are clear if you read the hotel web site. It's only 5 minutes from Termini, but very quiet and safe if you're travelling alone, and there are plenty of cheap places to eat nearby as well as a couple of internet cafes. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I've had in Italy, though the coffee and juice aren't great. Food is plentiful and there is loads of choice. They even provided a little basket of chocolate eggs on Easter Sunday, and the lovely staff let me eat late when I woke up late on my first morning. Recommended for a safe, pleasant stay with good transport links in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Roma Temini Station, friendly staff, small but clean room, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Astoria Garden Hotel in Rome. First off, we arrived at the hotel around 12:00pm, and they graciously allowed us to check in 2 hours early. As stated, the rooms are very small (we had to place 1 suitcase on the desk in order to be able to walk around the bed). However, they are clean, and our room had a balcony overlooking the garden, which was quite nice. The breakfast is good, mostly pastries, breads, meats and cheeses. The convenience of being located 2 blocks from Termini Station is this hotel's best asset. The 1 problem we had with this establishment was their WiFi. Although their website states free WiFi, this is not the case. You receive 1 free hour of WiFi (you must obtain a username and password from the front desk, and the 60 minutes starts the moment your password is given). After that 1 hour, we were told that access would no longer be free, so we chose not to bother anymore. Quite inconvenient when we were expecting free access. Overall, a good hotel and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: earth-trekker-x2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just walking distance from the termini (which will get you to the most attractions at the least amount of time). It also saves a lot coming from the airport since there transport from airport to termini is cheaper versus airport to other locations. The staff is very very accommodating and helpful. The breakfast buffet (in my personal view) is one of the good ones i have had in all of the other hotels we have stayed at in Italy. Wifi reached our 1st floor rooms - and it is free - definite A+ for a someone who loves to check tripadvisor for where to eat or go next! Lastly, we saw a laundromat (where you can leave your stuffs and someone will do the washing and drying and folding for you!) very near the hotel so another plus if you want to travel light.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel2205
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and pleasant. We were allocated a double room on the second floor at the front of the property.The room was a little small, particularly the bathroom. We would have expected 'in room' tea and coffee making facilities. However, buffet breakfast was a good start to the day and the reception staff were very pleasant, helpful and available at any time and even made an advanced booking for a restaurant at the end of the road for our first night, Medi Napoli - not disappointed and made second visit. Hotel close to transport links but within walking distance of most historic sites, (minutes away you can catch the 40 Express for the Vatican, 1 euro each - ideal). We also visited Mamma Angela's Restaurant (twice) loacted in the road to the rear of the hotel, book both restaurants not to be disappointed, nice atmosphere, good food and staff were great. The restaurant across the road from Mamma Angelo's is to be avoided. In our bedroom sockets were not near mirrors, room had economy lighting and a little dim. Opening of the shutters in daylight is essential. Bed was extremely comfortable providing excellent sleep. We would recommend the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: whyte85 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the Termini :-). Short walk to sights! Hotel staff very helpful and even upgraded us. Room was spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie137
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice - once in a single room and once in a double. The rooms are small but both opened up to the lovely garden. Staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and the location is very convenient for Termini. The breakfast buffet was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tsturgess
Reviews.Content: Staff were so friendly and helpful-rooms spotless,really convenient to transport and not that far away that you couldn't walk to all the main attractions anyway.Only criticism was we were in room in garden area which was lovely setting but a tad small and could do with more natural light.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and very convenient location but rather disappointed with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: georgepap_10
Reviews.Content: Good and friendly staff, a very Italian atmosphere, clean rooms, adequate breakfast buffet , nice location;these didn't suffice to make a very good impression to us.We were given two rooms in the ground floor in the garden area. These rooms were much smaller in comparison to the main building rooms. We often heard the TV humming form the adjacent rooms, and a t a couple of times ants crawling. We couldn't, however , ask for an upgrade or for a room change because the hotel was small and almost fully booked, due to the Xmas vacations. The second disappointment came for the very restricted free WiFi access we had, because the management considered logical the fact that free WiFi was supposed to be given only to those booking via intenet directly. But overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, nice rooms! :)”
Reviews.Author: Melinda M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room here with my mother and my aunt and uncle also stayed at the hotel. We loved the location of this hotel - very close to Termini - and felt it was a safe and quiet neighbourhood. Compared to other cities, Rome isn't really so big and we did a lot of walking while we were there but through Termini station, a number of sights are accessible using the Rome Metro lines (both lines go to Termini). The hotel staff were helpful in helping us book tours and in recommending places for us to eat and visit and in giving us directions! The free breakfast isn't anything special (I was disappointed with the croissants which were always hard) but it was free and enough to get us started for the day! The staff who also worked in the breakfast area were also very pleasant! There are no mini refrigerators in the rooms but as it was winter when we were there, the shutter doors closed made for a good place to store our water and other things we wanted to keep cool; the bar downstairs is able to provide some ice for guests but it's only a very minimal amount. I would recommend Hotel Astoria Garden to families, couples or solo travelers as a great place to stay for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “interesting”
Reviews.Author: teargas
Reviews.Content: Initially I was by myself for a night before I met my family. When I stayed single the room was not much bigger than the bed, if you suffer from claustrophobia you would freak out. When I was in the family room that was much better and there was plenty of room considering what they say about European hotels. Breakfast was good, usual ham/cheese/breads and cereals. Staff were nice enough. Hotel is close to the main train station which was good for access to the local areas. Overall, pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “So small”
Reviews.Author: golisw
Reviews.Content: You can see in the picture how small the room is. It works fine if you are there one night. Several nights and two suit cases later, well, its crowded. Our room was quiet as it was facing a small garden. The hotel is also on a quiet side street. Breakfast was good for the price. The staff were very nice. Close to termini---i don't recommend staying in a different area if you have to drag your suitcases through the metro----they have lots of stairs! You can walk to the termini buses, the national museum, the baths of Diocletian, and the Church with St. Theresa in Ecstasy. The neighborhood felt fine late at night. The hotel next to it had a good rating in our travel guide book.

Reviews.Title: “Shower screen door shattered”
Reviews.Author: EnricoMelb
Reviews.Content: On our second morning in this hotel in August 2011 my wife went to close the shower door and it fell off its track and shattered. My wife received cuts to her hands and feet. It had work perfectly the day before. The hotel staff quickly attended to the problem however the manager made comment that we would be charged for the damage. My wife objected strongly and we were told it would be OK. The next morning we checked out and nothing was said. On return back to Australia we had received a email to say that they had charged our Visa credit card Euro 300 for the repair. I have advise the hotel that we were not in full control of the hotel room and possibly the cleaning staff may have dislodged the door. When my wife went to close it it came off it rails. They have not supported my argument and have made me pay the full amount. Because of the deception and the fact they have held us to ransom and charging our credit card with no compromise I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice before cruise”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRetired
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three nights at Astoria Gardens. Our twin bed room was clean, quiet and looked over the garden setting. Breakfast was very nice with a good variety of food. Good places to eat are within a few blocks of hotel...plus a nice gelato shop. Having Termini Rail & metro stations 5-10 min. away was convenient. For our cruise, taking train to port was only $4.50 Euro versus 130.00 shuttle service. Don't let someone help you put bags on train as a fellow passenger said it was done for a tip...and they were put on wrong train. Luckily they found out in time!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MikeB45
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this friendly and well-managed hotel. Our room and the entire facility was immaculate, indicating pride of management. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate. Only a few blocks from Termini station, it is quite easy to walk to the hotel after a train ride in from Fiumicino airport. Public transportation all over the city is readily available from Termini, and there are numerous restaurants, pizzerias and even a large grocery store with an extensive wine section only a couple of blocks away. There is no question we will choose this hotel again when in Rome. I wish we could find a place like this in every city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel : Excellent Location : Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TractorJohn
Reviews.Content: Small, very clean, and had one of two quaint rooms on the lower floor, with a walkout to a small patio overlooking a lovely and quiet garden/sitting area. The first night we were there, too tired to go out, asked if the hotel could get us some cold wine. And they did ... an excellent white wine, complete with an ice bucket, real wine glasses, and popcorn, delived to our little outdoor patio. Our five weeks in Italy started out well! The entire staff were *very* helpful, and pleasant. Many restaurants within a 2 block walk. About five minutes to the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Good location decent sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tristan A
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, assisting us to organise a tour in Rome that allowed us to see all of the major attractions in the only full day we had in the city. Anything we needed was just a quick chat away. The room was quite good and the bed gave us a decent couple of nights sleep. The room had a balcony overlooking the gardens and made for a nice relaxation area. The staff at reception and the bar very courteous and efficient. There is some street parking out the front of the hotel and it is very close to Termni Station. The tours offer a pick up service from the hotel which makes it very convenient. Decent hotel would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Ron R
Reviews.Content: Overall good value, a bit of an issue with one of our party with a broken plumbing faucet, but resolved with the owner without further problems. Good breakfest and well run operation. Close to the bus lines and train station. Room was a bit small and the bed a bit hard, but overall OK.

Reviews.Title: “stayed at better”
Reviews.Author: beth r
Reviews.Content: On the second day the shower handle broke off into my hand. The owner of the hotel accused us of being way too rowdy in the shower with the handle -I was showeing alone. I promise you I was not having a Frat party at 0600hrs before our walking tour. He proceeded to wave around the sheered of piece in our faces and yelled at us that it cost him 30 euro while we stood in the lobby. Needless to say I do not recommend this hotel b/c of his unprofessional behavior. Attempted to order drinks from him later in the trip and he got frustrated with us when we asked for ice and gave attitude the rest of the trip. Don't let him fool you...he speaks English very well!! The hotel was very nice and the AC blew cold. Rooms are small but true to sizes of hotel rooms in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: 24tun8
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with my sister and 10 year old son.. Staff was very welcoming. Breakfast buffet was good. Room was the typical size for a European hotel. Bathroom was great. Will definitely stay again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPeteShow
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Astoria Garden Hotel. I booked it on the basis of the positive reviews it has received on Tripadvisor, and I was not disappointed. The location is terrific if you are travelling by train. It is a genuine 5 - 10 minute walk from Termini. The walk is flat, and it's very easy to find. The staff are brilliant. They are more than happy to provide advice about what to do and where to go. They really display the "nothing is a problem" attitude, that sometimes isn't present in Italian hotels! Being in the same area as many of the backpacker establishments, the area is well stocked with affordable eating options, laundromats and internet cafes. Reception will point you in the right direction. It's main drawcard is the lovely garden area in the courtyard. It's a green, tranquil oasis - a lovely spot to chill out with a beer after a hard day's site seeing. You can almost forget you're in the middle of a major city. Our room had an enormous bed, wardrobe, safe facilities, and an enormous bathroom by European standards. Unfortunately, on the morning of our departure, the hot water system wasn't working - but these things happen. They were very apologetic. The Termini area isn't the most picturesque area of Rome, but if you're passing through, this place is perfect. If you're staying longer in Rome, I'd look for something a bit closer to the major attractions. I would have no hesitation in staying at the Astoria Garden Hotel again, and am more than happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: jmd87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel my last night in Rome. It's close to the Termini station which was very convenient when I had to get up early on my last day to head to the airport. The room was small and very minimalistic but it was clean and the bathroom was very nice. Friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel if you just need a hotel for a night or two. But for a longer trip I would want to stay somewhere more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Feb´06”
Reviews.Author: migo23
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nearby Termini and metro station, nice staff. Maybe far away from center to go walking. Room was so good and clean. I would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: rcmgriffith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we went on a Cruise. Its a lovely hotel, the staff were very helpful, I emailed them before we left and received directions from the Termini station, they even told me which exit to take. We arrived early and they let us check into our room. Recommended a local restaurant, which was excellent. This hotel is in a great location for Termini, which gives you fantastic access to all the sights, either by bus or Metro. Lots of places to eat nearby. Wish we had booked this for out return stay in Rome, but they were fully booked once we decided that we would stay for 2 nights before coming home after our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff1980
Reviews.Content: After another hotel canceled my reservation, I walked around the Termini area searching for a new hotel. Of them all Astoria Garden really impressed me with the professionalism and efficiency (rare in Italy, no offense) of their front desk. They were extremely helpful and even printed out a train schedule for us. Lobby was quite nice and rooms were clean and decent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawnysug
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just come back from Rome and had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel. It was booked on the recommendation of a friend and we could not fault it. The hotel is quiet even though it is close to the termini. There are a few nice restaurants nearby and the Via Nazionale is only a 5 minute walk away. The number 64 bus was nowhere near as scarry as all the guidebooks make out!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but great environment!”
Reviews.Author: leat023
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised to walk into our itty bitty room, but we weren't in there very often with all the activities we had planned so it didn't really bother us. The bed was very hard though so I didn't sleep too great, but the lobby of the hotel is very pretty and the courtyard is full of flowers and orange trees. The staff was so helpful and very friendly too! It was very close to the bus/train station and only took about 10-15 minutes to walk to places such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon. The colosseum is about 20-25 minutes walking distance but we just got on a hop-on, hop-off tour bus for that. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but shame about breakfast......”
Reviews.Author: mitzilondonuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in june for 4 nights. great location, excellent room,beautiful garden and nice staffs. But shame about breakfast.... nothing like a photo on their website.... fruit juices were powderly.... no fresh coffee..... cheap cereals.... we love italian coffee to start a day.... so dissapointed....

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: esjc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at this hotel and had a pleasant time. It close proximity to the Termini Station was a bonus and the hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was what we expected--smaller compared to North American standards but was very clean. The one negative was that the bed was too hard. The breakfast was good. We did enjoy the courtyard which allowed us to relax from our busy days touring in Rome. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Visitors from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: RTootles
Reviews.Content: Great location near the train station, easy to find but not noisy. Room as quite small but clean. Everything we needed. Staff helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good - selection of breads, cakes, fruit, yoghurt and tea. Would definately recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great...except the internet”
Reviews.Author: tallguy187
Reviews.Content: Good location being near the train station but without the noise. This means you are near everywhere the trains/metro go. Staff multilingual, breakfast availiable and standard. Clean, very luxurious type of feel the stairs have. Only complaint was that the wifi didnt work I complained about it to no avail. Ah well, there is a small web cafe nearby that had internet access for dirt cheap. But overall a good stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Minor quibbles, but overall pleasant”
Reviews.Author: pauld581
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astoria for just two nights in June, part of a larger trip. As others have mentioned, it's not really close to any of the major tourist sites, and IMO that's a plus. It is close to Termini station, where most every tourist jaunt begins, so there's no downside to the location. Besides, it is walking distance to the coliseum, etc (if you like walking), and there are plenty of interesting sites in their own right just walking around the Piazza Indipendenza area and towards the coliseum. For a city as busy as Rome, and a neighborhood as bustling as Termini, the hotel is quiet and the courtyard is a welcome retreat. Bar service in the courtyard was sporadic, often requiring us to hunt down a server, but it wasn't a super-big issue. Just get big beers! It's been mentioned elsewhere but worth repeating that despite what it says on the hotel website, the wifi is not free, if you have NOT booked through the hotel's site. Since most people go through brokers that means for most people it's not free. They charge 5 euros or so a day for it after the first hour, which is fine, but we didn't know about this at the time we booked. After I complained pretty loudly about it -there is no disclaimer/qualifier on the website; it just says "free wifi"- they finally did just give it to us, albeit in a manner that seemed like they were doing us some super huge favor. Another issue was the lack of an in-room refrigerator, and in fact of seven hotels that we stayed in in Italy, it was the only hotel to not have one. Maybe a minor issue to some, but important to us. Also, the breakfast coffee was about the worst I have ever had, anywhere. Some hotels have taken to using these automatic espresso/cappuccino makers that just cannot produce a drinkable cup of coffee. Others hotels do it too, but in Italy??? We were so tired from trumping around Rome that I must admit that I didn't even notice the hard mattresses that others have complained about. As far as I remember, the room's furnishing and cleanliness were just fine, so no complaints from us. Other than these quibbles, and oh yeah a TERRIBLE restaurant recommendation from them, I would recommend the Hotel Astoria Gardens as nice budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: DBrownCT
Reviews.Content: Staff here was very helpful with getting around and giving directions. The hotel is only a few blocks from the train, which was very helpful since we were traveling to Florence after a few days. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was basic. Only complaint is the juice from the machine. Not very tasty. Overall, very pleasant stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: live2run
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed here while visiting Rome. Nice clean hotel with excellent breakfast. Very nice staff, available to answer your questions any time. Very close to train station and the metro, so very eazy to get places. We walked to most places, except the Vatican. The only complain and I has was the beds, super hard. Almost like sleeping on the floor. I would return when in Rome, but I sure hope they will replace their mattrases by the time I get back there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: extraordineri
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and found it to be a pleasant experience. The hotel is nice and the staff is friendly and accommodating. They speak English very well if that is a concern of yours. Overall the hotel is clean and has quite a little charm to it. There is free breakfast which consists of the usual European spread of breads, fruit, cereal, yogurt, cheese, and ham, along with a selection of juices and coffee. They claim to have free WIFI but in actuality it's only one hour free and after that it's 5 Euros a day. But frankly, that seems good since the free WIFI throughout the city has not quite taken flight yet. It's in the works but most have to pay for WIFI. The location is nice, away from all the commotion. Our room was quiet. There is a school across the street and with the windows fully closed it drowned out the noise of the students and traffic enough for a good rest. Room had air and heat so keeping the windows closed in the heat won't be an issue. Bathrooms are clean and nice with marble and jet tub (although, ours didn't work). The location is away from all the major attractions in the city but it's close to Termini Station which is the starting point for many tours and transportation. Comes in handy too for train travel and even shopping and eating with a 5 minute walk to the station. There are several shops and restaurants within walking distance and because it's away from all the major tourist spots you don't run into as many tourist as the city center. Rome is busy, almost to the point of NYC, so if you can find a quiet pocket in the city it's a nice thing. This hotel might be that place.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: kdjc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near Termini, with good restaurants nearby, on a quiet side street. The garden in the back was a perfect place for us to have lunch, which we grabbed at the supermarket across the street. Laundry was down the street, and gave us a discount for staying at the hotel. The front desk staff was superb...they were helpful, answered all of our questions, and directed us to where we needed to go. The bar was nice, with great cappuccino, that they delivered to our room. Breakfast was nice as well. Fresh croissants each morning, and fresh fruit. This hotel was a great value and I chose it based on location, the fact that it had a safe in the room and a hair dryer, and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FussySam
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed by this little hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (if a little on the small side) and the staff are very, very helpful and friendly. (Thank you for recommending the 'Made in Naples' restaurant, a wonderful find, very close after a hard days walking and very reasonably priced). We had a ground floor room on the garden side, which was lovely (we paid for an upgrade which was well worth it). The hotel itself is very near to the bus station and the Metro, but everything is within walking distance if you want to take in all the sights on the way. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a resonabley priced city break in Rome. Thanks Astoria Garden for a lovely city break!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant visit, friendly, helpful staff, well enjoyed!"”
Reviews.Author: trileaem
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Astoria Garden Hotel in Rome in April 2011. Everything was fully acceptable. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful, and the included breakfast was pleasant, even if the coffee was a bit strong for our taste. The Astoria Garden Hotel is tiny by city hotel standards, but we would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel to arrive in Roma”
Reviews.Author: linecemary
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very good value for the rates I have paid. All was more than expected except maybe the size of the rooms which are small but comfortable. View on the garden is a plus in the capital of Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: 186605Anne
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend in Rome and we stayed at the Astoria Garden Hotel.I have to say it was a great Hotel.On our arrival we were given a great friendly welcome and also given an upgrade to a lovely room overlooking the beautiful garden with Oranges growing on the tree.It was such a lovely peaceful Oasis right in the middle of Rome.The location was excellent as it was only a couple of minutes away from Termini Station and we used the metro from there and it was so handy going to and from the Airport.Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and every one of them always greeted us with a smile.The room was spotless as was the whole hotel.On our return at night we had a nightcap in the lovely well stocked bar.Breakfast was very good and kept us going each day until lunchtime.I would highly recommend it and hope some day to come back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: DeanVH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended to me and I would also recommend too. We paid the extra to be picked up at the airport and taken back which was efficient. On arrival we were warmly greeted and all questions answered. The room was clean and the bed as it turned out very comfortable. Doors lead out to a terrace overlooking a small, pretty garden complete with orange trees. A tip with our shower was to open the tap part way to keep the temperature constant rather than fully open. Breakfast was buffet style and was repeated daily but there was enough choice to vary what you ate. The staff at reception and the bar were friendly and recommended an excellent local restaurant where we ate twice. Menu was in Italian but we were helped out and enjoyed the food. Location was north of the Termini but we walked every day and found everything accessible and enjoyed the walking as you see more. However, buses were available at the Termini. All in all very enjoyable and we will be back to Rome, staying at The Astoria Garden!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely rooms and a good location.”
Reviews.Author: spudqueen82
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Our room was lovely and very clean. We had a private terrace overlooking the garden and I only wish it had been warmer so I could have made more of it. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was standard continental, but of a good standard. If the hotel wanted to improve the breakfast I would suggest that they have a member of staff on hand to make fresh hot drinks rather than rely on a machine, but that would probably put the prices up. The location was great, even though I'd heard a few negative reports beforehand about the area round the termini, we didn't have any problems. In fact because we were close to termini the transport links were excellent. It seemed that where ever we were in Rome we could get a bus back to termini. When I stay in Rome again (I did throw a coin in the Fountain of Trevi!) I will definintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay,i hope the owner reads this and takes care of his workers”
Reviews.Author: tsmagoo
Reviews.Content: great place.staff were excelent.included breakfast not bad.always someone who spoke english.but the main thing for a first time rome visitor is,in my opinion,be close to termini station.bus,train,subway,all right close to astoria garden.there are many hotels in this area.i can only say how we were treated here and it was very good.i would stay here again if that trevi fountain wish came true because they(the staff,and i hope the owner reads these reviews)were great.we were about 3 blocks from termini station and there are hotels right across the street but i wouldn't take a chance of less quality staffsmanship,if that is the correct word.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike_and_Gill
Reviews.Content: We were staying 2 nights in Rome before joining a cruise in Civitavecchia so wanted something close by to the termini station. If you take the Leonardo Express from Rome Airport prepare yourself for a long walk from the platform to the main body of the station. Once you make it there head for Via Marsala exit, from there it is a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. When we arrived our bags were taken from us on the street (by a member of staff) and we quickly completed check in and were shown to our garden room. The room had everything we needed, comfortable double bed, shower-room and television with a couple of English news channels. Outside there was a table and two chairs and despite being a November it was warm enough to sit outside with a gin and tonic. The gentleman on reception kindly recommended a close by restaurant, Mamma Anglela's, which was just around the corner and perfect for us. We stopped by the well stocked bar for a night cap on our return, a great end to our first evening in Rome. We had booked a garden room bed and breakfast rate of around €90.00 per night for the double room which was great value. The buffet breakfast offered a variety of breads, cereals, cheese and meat and hot and cold drinks and was perfectly adequate. The hotel is also in a great location for sightseeing with the metro and bus network criss-crossing at the Termini station although we did most of our sightseeing on foot. If you are looking to stock up on food and drink there is a small supermarket by the via Marsala entrance, lower floor, at Termini station. Our room and the hotel was spotlessly clean and everything exactly as described on the website. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: terryseal
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay (first time in Rome) here. I picked it because of good reviews on the site and it's proximity to Roma Termini (as I was going to be traveling via train at the end of the stay.) The desk managers were very friendly and helpful with dinner suggestions in the neighborhood. Had a nice cappuccino when we arrived. The room was a bit on the small side, but was plenty comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “5nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: spock1701
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to stay in such a good hotel.The staff were wonderful ,nothing to much trouble & always helpful with advice on bus routes & Rome in general. Breakfast was good with cooked meats ,cheese,cereals,pastries etc. The room was clean & plenty big enough & cleaned daily with fresh towels provided;the garden area was an added bonus.Many thanks to the staff for a great stay. The weather was wet & very stormy during our stay (7Nov-12Nov)which meant we did not see everyting we intented to as a lot of the ancient city is outside ;although we did manage the Colosseum & Palatine Hill inbetween the thunder storms but had to give up on the Forum.The Vatican & all it's wonderful treasures is a must &the paintings,architecture are amazing. Ciampino Airport which is used mainly by the cheaper airlines is small ,don't be too eager to go through passport control like we did coming back as you will only find a couple of vending machines for refreshments(coffee is awful)& seats .There is a cafe between security/passport control.If you get a taxi to/from airport to city centre use the white cabs as there is a set fare,we were prepared &when approached by a guy wanting 60euros we said no &he pointed us in the direction of the white cabs. Rome is expensive when it comes to eating out ,expect to pay 8euros for a pizza,3euros for a glass of wine,medium beer 6uros(less than a pint)we never got away with less than 40euros for dinner .We were warned about prices but having been to other cities we were quite shocked. We did however find a great wee pizza takeaway/eat in just round the corner from the hotel called Rustic run by a lovely couple who served up wonderful pizza ,2cans of pepsi&plenty of pizza for under 10euros great value. As is always the case on the Friday morning when we left the weather was dry!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis within busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: rapture_74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in August, and thorougly enjoyed our stay. Upon our rather early arrival, we were upgraded to a garden view room with balcony. We thank the staff so much for this, since the days in Rome were so hot, it was always good to come back to the hotel with a nice view of the garden. Breakfast was very good. However I am curious about the "Orange Juice" - it did not taste like real orange juice. This hotel is great value for money, and if we come back to Rome we will definitely be staying here. Only 5-10 mins walk to the main train station. Regards Rapture

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in comfort, cleanliness and staff helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: travelerpiscataway
Reviews.Content: The building is very interesting; the rooms are impeccably maintained; the courtyard is a great place to sit and talk; the staff was extraordinarily helpful in assisting me when I checked in still in the throes of airsickness.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL, VERY NEAR TERMINI”
Reviews.Author: makemking
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 5 minute walk from termini via Marsala exit. Nice and quiet, spotless and garden was lovely, bathroom tiny but adequate, very convenient for restaurants at night, walk around any corner and spoilt for choice. Desk staff helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: capitalcitytiger
Reviews.Content: Walked in to this hotel on the next to last day of a 10 day run in Italy. Rate was very reasonable and the room was great. Staff was extremely helpful and the location was great. i would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nathaniels_Uncle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the money. The rooms are fine, the location is great and the courtyard garden is a great place to unwind when you need to escape the crush of Rome! The air con worked really well, which was a huge plus for us as Rome was crazy hot when we were there. The front desk and the bartender/gardener/bell hop guy were very friendly. Other posters have mentioned how hard the beds are. They are hard, but no harder than any other bed we had in Italy and I got a great sleep on the hard bed! There are only two small down sides to this hotel. One is that the water temperature in the shower is inconsistent and can go chilly on you all of a sudden. The other is the manager who makes it quite clear that customers are really just a nuisance that must be tolerated. That said, he can be ignored as everyone else is super.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of rates - right hotel for the right people.”
Reviews.Author: Yarmaz
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our Italy tour. 2 adults and 2 kids (9 and 11yrs). We booked a quad room. I'll start with the pros. It's a cute little hotel with a lovely garden area in a very central location for sightseeing. Some (most?) of the rooms have balconies and/or patios leading out to the garden area. Ours did not. The cons: The rooms are extremely small as compared to the other 3 and 4 star hotels we stayed at. Our room, 112, had no balcony and was very dark. We booked a quad room for 336 euros (w/o taxes) per night. Upon arrival we were very disappointed at the rooms size given the price. I asked at the desk and was told there were no other options. On the second day of our stay I discovered that the current rate for our room was 138 euros. That is a reasonable rate for the room. The management refused to work with us on the rate. In the end they offered another room with a small balcony for the last night only. We decided it wasn't worth the trouble to pack up for just one night. So, beware of the rates. Be prepared for the small room size. Other than that it's a lovely place in a great location. Oh, hubby says to add that the "full breakfast" is very rudimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mchy
Reviews.Content: we took the train from the airport and it was easy to get to the hotel, as long as you take the Via Marsala exit.......just go up the road opposite the station and then the 3rd left, just 5 min. I have read that the Termini area can be abit dodgy but all 4 of us felt safe, the other side of the station did look pretty grim. The station is big with alot of shops and places to eat, so if you are going for the first time you will not be short of anything. There is also a Spar supermarket nearby so it is best to stock up, especially drinking water because unfortunately the hotel does not provide drinking water...........if you buy a small bottle of water from street vendor or newsagent you're paying about 2 euros and from the supermarket a 1 litre bottle is about 30cs, also it is wise to stock up on snacks from there especially if you have teenagers!!! The hotel was clean, towels and bedding changed everyday, breakfast was a buffet with plenty of choices......only thing is that when I booked in March I did request both rooms together which we didn't get, but rooms were only 2 doors away...it was ok. First 3 nights were peacefull for me and my daughter but then we had a young couple move in next door on our last night, that is when I realised that the walls are thin!! The rooms are a ok size, father and son got the smaller room. All in all the holiday was great, the tour bus we used starts from the station, 51 euros for 48 hrs hop on hop off for all 4 of us...I think it was called Roma tour bus, other tour buses seemed abit more pricey but they went along the same route. Also train tickets are pricey at 14 euros each and or if want a taxi then it is set price at 40 euros,just confirm price before you jump in.....we got a taxi back to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sutter93
Reviews.Content: We originally picked this hotel because it seemed as though the managers must care about it to respond to any negative opinions on TripAdvisor. We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel in rome. The good: -Great location -Very, very helpful staff -GREAT price for what you get (you won't find better value in Rome) -Nice, clean rooms (air conditioned) -Allowed us to store our bags The bad: -A little bit of noise from the street when you sleep as it is a busy area being near Termini... but this sound is minimal Don't listen to the negative reviews - we stay in 4-star hotels in Italy that were not even close to the standards of this 3-star hotel Thank you Astoria Garden

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ggllk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is of course not a luxury hotel but it feels much better than most of hotels out there hanging a 3-star sign on their doorstep. The owner obviously cares about his property and about the guests -which is nowadays rare enough to be noticed!-. It is clean and I suspect was renovated no too long ago. I had a single room which was, as expected, quite small but I have seen much worse! Air conditioning in the room was a great plus! Breakfast is simple, yet enjoyable: pastries, cereals, cheese, ham, salami... Staff is nice and very helpful, well ready to answer to all your questions. As for location, it is a few minutes walk from the Termini station (main station) and it is also very close to a bus that will allow you to virtually reach any major spot of the city. As a conclusion, it is a great value for the money and i wish more hotels to be like this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Gscott8075
Reviews.Content: We used the Astoria Gardens as our home base while spending two weeks in Europe. The staff was incredibly friendly and offered assistance whenever possible. They helped us in a variety of ways - I cannot speak enough about their passion for taking care of guests. This was our first time in Rome and the location is extremely convenient considering we needed to use Termini on several occasions to move around. We stayted overnight, left on a cruise, came back for two nights, went to Sorrento and came back for the last night of our trip. They recommended good restaurants within walking distance, offered to keep some of our luggage between trips, and arranged airport transportation. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveSp
Reviews.Content: We spent the first two nights of a 3 week trip to Italy and the Adriatic Coast at the Astoria Garden Hotel. For us as leisure travelers it had everything we wanted. Very convenient to Rome Termini Station, very clean bathroom, clean comfortable bed, extremely quiet, good breakfast, and friendly staff who provided detailed directions to locations like the Catacombs out on the Via Appia Antica (which required using both the subway and a bus), and good restaurant recommendations. The French window of our ground floor room opened out on a separately fenced patio with a table and chairs within the garden area. The room was simply furnished and relatively small, but we found the bed comfortable. I was particularly impressed by the fact that the room was very, very quiet. We ate at restaurants recommended by the front desk both evenings. When we told the restaurants that we had been sent by the Astoria Garden Hotel, we were given free Limoncello at the end of the meals.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable stay bordering on creepy”
Reviews.Author: CaveatConsumers
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the desk agent requested that a young man accompany us to the room (mind you he did not offer to carry the bags, which was not a problem). He then proceeded to show us how to turn on the lights,show us that the TV had CNN, that there was one towel each, one soap each, on shampoo each...we felt we were being mocked. The room was clean and remodeled but small and with high ceilings. The limited lighting gave it a gloomy appearance. The double bed we discovered to be two small twins joined together with an uncomfortable something or other over the gap in the middle. As someone else already mentioned the pillows are thin and hard, but generally the pillows in 3 star European hotels are far below the standard available in the USA. While we had expected to have free Wi-Fi, it turned out that we were only allowed one continuous hour for the whole stay for which we had to go to the front desk and get a printed login and password from the front desk. The printout paper bore the insignia of the German eagle facing left, which was popular during the Third Reich. Basically, that eagle was everywhere in the hotel. For Wi-Fi access beyond the one free continuous hour (meaning you could not use it up in portions), the hotel charges 5 €uros per hour, which is pretty ridiculous. In Paris and Madrid similar hotels provided free Wi-Fi, and a block away from the Astoria Garden an internet café provided access for half the price in quarter hour slots (75 cents for quarter hour, 2.50 € for an hour). Adding insult to injury, the hotel Wi-Fi signal was very weak, which meant that to make phone calls via internet we had to go down to the small guest area next to the lobby. Talking there did not seem to go over well with the manager who seemed to be constantly hovering around. The buffet breakfast is good, but during our stay we did not hear any guest speak anything but German and generally every table was very subdued. It seemed as people were afraid to talk and have fun. There is a nice area with tangerine trees in the inner courtyard, although again we did not see people sitting there to enjoy themselves. We also noted tension between the German (maybe Austrian ?) management and the local Roman staff. The hotel is about a half kilometer from the main train station, Termini, so it is easily accessible. Many other hotels and restaurants are nearby, and a good supermarket (Supermercati Sir) just a couple of blocks away if you want to save on food. Check out time is noon, and my partner got delayed returning to the hotel so I rushed back and packed. I told the front desk that I would be out at noon, and the answer was “Yes, please”. Since I could not carry all of the bags out at once, my second bag was carried for me to the sidewalk outside where I waited for my partner because I was afraid to wait inside by the lobby once the clock struck noon. Management seemed to be anxious to get rid of us and we were equally anxious to leave even though no words were ever exchanged. We do not drink, do not smoke (it is a smoke free hotel) and we made no noise during our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we found this hotel on Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: cheshireangel
Reviews.Content: It was a few years since we'd been to Rome so when we had booked budget flights we were surprised to find how much the hotel prices had gone up. We were therefore searching for a reasonably priced place to stay - we weren't expecting high quality we just wanted somewhere convenient, clean, well organised and reasonable cost. That was exactly what we got with the Astoria Garden. From our initial enquiry to the minute we left they were friendly and organised. When we next go to Rome we would definitely use the hotel again - it is very close to the Termini and therefore underground and bus terminal too so great for getting about. There was also a reasonably priced place to eat with wood burning pizza oven just around the corner. My only (slight) negative was only getting one pillow and a very hard mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gonetotraveleurope
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! Staff was wonderful and more than helpful...all speak English. Breakfast was very good! Rooms were small but have everyhting you need. Great location to trains and such. Would stay 100x over!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, clean & comfortable, room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyDownUnder
Reviews.Content: Fantastic find in Rome. Close to Roma Termini station - less than 5 mins walk. Beware of the train station at night - my brother got pick pocketed there. Hotel itself is very clean, and comfortable. Overall cleanliness was impressive. Room quite small - a guad room was a double bed & 2 singles, but one of the single beds was placed at the foot of the double bed like it was an afterthought. So not much space, but we had a balcony overlooking the gardens which was nice, and had big doors that opened for plenty of fresh air. Cupboard in room as well as safe. Free breakfast ok. Staff extremely helpful & polite. Good experience with this hotel. Wifi available if you have a laptop 5 euro for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: happylittlebuddha
Reviews.Content: So glad to have found this hotel! The location was perfect- short walk to Termini station. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially with tips on purchasing our tickets from Termini to the airport. Room was a bit small but what European hotel room isn't? The bathroom was a good size with a nice size shower. All in all, a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “clean and warm,small room average location”
Reviews.Author: AgentAC
Reviews.Content: located a few block away from the train station so moving around the city with the metro is easy (taxi rides are about 10 euro to the main attractions). not the most pleasant location specially at night due to the station. clean and warm room but my room as a single was no larger than on a boat with paper thin walls. breakfast was nothing from the standard. 1 hour free wifi access and 5 euro for 24h. will recommend this hotel for a budget,quick visit, without small children. service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sunshine2305
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed there for 3 nights in February. The hotel is located 3 minutes walking distance from Termini Station so it is easy to get anywhere You want from there. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but very nice and cozy, and it was very clean. We enjoyed our stay there very much and we would definitely recommend these place :) If we go back to Rome we are gonna use Astoria Garden Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emj_10 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to Rome mainly to watch the Rugby so just wanted a cheap hotel for some sight seeing too. The hotel was lovely, very clean and well located (very close to the Termini.) We walked to the Collossium and other locations more than once and if you are prepared to walk its brilliant. Beds are not the most comfortable I have experienced but were find for a couple of nights. The hotel did not do evening meals which was what we expected but there are quite a few restaurants just around the corner - try Mamma Angelas and the Pizzarie on the corner. We enjoyed both - more than once!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mel0325
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astoria Garden Hotel from January 30 through February 2 and I was very pleased with my stay. It is VERY close to the Roma Termini, which was great, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are a little small, but I was traveling by myself so it was the perfect size for me. If my husband had come with me, I think the room still would have been the perfect size. The only con I noticed was that you do have to pay for the WiFi after the first free hour but it is only 5 euros per 24 hour period, definitely a better rate than some other hotels in Europe. I just recommended this hotel to a friend of mine who is traveling to Rome this year and not only will I continue to recommend it, I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in the city. Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 10/10 Friendly and helpful staff perfect location very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jason25_10
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and friendly. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Loved our bed and breakfest in the mornings. Great value!!! Would certainetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, especially for travelling to/from both of Rome's airports”
Reviews.Author: slk86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from Termini. This is good if you are using the Leonardo Express train from the Fiumicino airport. Plus, if you want to travel to the Ciampino airport, you can use the Terravision Bus. The bus stop is located on 22 Via Marsala, which is also at the Termini station. The hotel is located opposite a graffitied and dodgy looking building. Sometimes you see teenagers hanging about the building smoking. So yes, the hotel may be close to the station, but it is in a dodgy-feeling area, so I would advise walking quickly back to the hotel at night time, and definitely not by yourself either. The rooms were more modern than I expected. Yes, they were clean, but I thought that the bed linen smelled slightly funny, like vinegar. Also, our room (room 205) was EXTREMELY hot and stuffy, even when we turned the temperature down. So, we left the balcony doors open to let in some fresh air, but the outer green shutter door did not lock properly, so if you are concerned about security like me, this is not good. The cold buffet breakfast was okay but not great. Had croissants, some pastries, cakes, bread, cereal, fruit etc. However, I was disappointed that they did not have a toaster. The hotel staff are quite helpful and friendly and spoke good English. Plus, the garden is quite charming and pretty. Note: I would not advise eating at the Florians cafe around the corner from the hotel. My spaghetti was really salty and my partner's prosciutto and mushroom pizza was so-so. The toilet was quite dirty

Reviews.Title: “amazingly rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: EricLo238
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fly to Rome because of bad weather conditions, so I called the hotel asking if there was anything I could do to get any type of refund. They said no, and were very rude about it. The receptionist just said, look at the contract, we will charge you full fee because you are canceling within 24 hours even though it wasn't my fault I couldn't fly to Rome. His advice later was, get easyjet to pay for your hotel, we can't control the weather, and then said goodbye and hung up. So incredibly rude, and I find the hotels policy not to even compromise a little bit, amazingly stupid. I offered to pay half of the booking and yet they said look at the contract. They can get more money for a lot of bad publicity. if you stay at his hotel, be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms clean, staff friendly and location superb”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwoLancashire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our friends, stayed at the Astoria Gardens for three nights. This was our first visit to Rome - and we weren't disappointed! This hotel was fantastic value for money and was conveniently situated within 5 mins walk of the Termini. The main purpose of a city break is to see as much as possible of the actual city rather than spending time in the hotel. Therefore we usually try to find a reasonably priced hotel and whilst we are not too concerned with 'small' rooms, we like cleanliness! This hotel gets top marks. The rooms were fairly basic, but were immaculately clean and had comfortable beds with fresh, clean bedding. The bathroom had a great shower and again was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the continental style breakfast was more than adequate to set you up for a day's sightseeing. The added bonus was the garden. We had rooms looking onto the garden. A small terrace provided a lovely quiet spot to enjoy a glass of wine on a balmy November evening before heading out to eat. After a long day, it was lovely to find a little cafe bar within two minutes walk of the hotel - Florians. The food (and wine!) here were lovely and not over priced. The desserts were divine! Turn right out of the hotel, then first left - it really is two minutes walk! Just one other point - it's worth investing in the Roma Pass. This provides two free admissions to the listed attractions, and reductions on any further visits. It also provides free travel on the public transport systems - metro, bus etc. See 'Roma Pass' website for further details. The cost was 23 Euro each when we purchased them and these can be purchased in the Termini building.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel. A pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Lordoftheinn
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned that our adventure to Rome,(Kim and I don't go on holiday, we have ADVENTURES). would get off to a bad start because our flight to Rome did not arrive until midnight and we thought the Hotel may let our room because we had not arrived. With this in mind i e-mailed the hotel and I was surprised to get a reply in english that everything was in order. A very good start. We had to get a taxi from the Airport because the Leonardo Express had finished its service at that time of night. Warning!!!!! Our taxi only had two speeds, warp factor nine or Stop. Because the Hotel was only three blocks away from the Station I asked the driver just to take us to Termini, we could walk the rest of the way. I didn't trust him to take us to the hotel without ripping us off. If you are a ladies or alone I don,'t recommend this walk at night a (few undesirables about). We arrived at the hotel to chained locked doors!!!! Thankfully the Duty Manager came to the door almost immediately was brilliantly efficient at checking us in. He even asked us if we would like A DRINK FROM THE BAR! The mans a genius. After 12 hours travelling it was exactly what we needed. He offered us a seat in the Garden which on that balmy September night and a long journey was a peaceful paradise. And so to our room, Small? Yes. Comfortable? Yes. Clean? Absolutely spotless 10/10. Bathroom? absolutely spotless. Shower? a little bit snug, but, I am not the smallest of fellows but then I ain't the biggest either. The bed was the firmest I have ever come across, I don't mind that at all but extra pillows would be good. I'm sure if I had asked they would have been provided I just did not want to be any trouble. I fully recommend this hotel to any body the cleanliness is exemplorary. The staff are brilliant, helpful and courteous. and the coutyard garden a joy especially with a cold beer and a good book.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great. Manager is EXTREMELY RUDE.”
Reviews.Author: travellingeducator
Reviews.Content: The location of this quaint hotel is excellent. It is located very near to Termini Station, on the "good side" in a neighborhood setting. The garden is beautiful. The room was great. The breakfast was good. There was some confusion, on our part, with the bill. When we asked questions, the manager became enraged. He ranted and raved about the economy and how hard it was to make a living. The more he talked the louder he screamed. He would not even permit us to ask our questions. It was very embarrassing---and amazing. On the other hand, the desk clerk, Lorenzo, was exceptional. He was kind and helpful. The manager needs to take some lessons from Lorenzo. Definitely stay at this hotel, just hope and pray that the manager has the day off when you are there!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: travellerl75
Reviews.Content: This was my final stop in Rome before returning to Canada, and I think it was a great hotel location, close to the Termini (less than 10min walk with luggage in tow). From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a smile, a gentleman ready to take our bags up stairs and show us around the property. The check in was smooth and in English. A clean room, up-to-date bathroom, but the beds were hard and only one thin pillow to lay your head. Continental breakfast was average compared to brand-name hotels...I'd suggest tea over coffee, also the fruits were nice! Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: matrix67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 6 nights with my wife. The rooms are clean (no bugs !), the people are friendly and the price reasonnable. The only minor points are: - the poor quality of the breakfast (no real coffee !) -a free WIFI connection is not included in the price of the room -the rooms are cleaned sometimes late in the day

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel - excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: 1lolly1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in August. The airport bus dropped us off at Termini station and we were at the hotel within 5 mins. We walked from the station and the hotel was very easy to find. We were greeted by the friendly receptionist and shown to our room straight away. The room was quite small but we were prepared for this and it was more than adequate. The bathroom was spotless and quite spacious. We were also delighted to see that we could open the patio doors in the room and walk out onto a lovely patio with a table and chairs. This area was looking onto the garden with the orange trees. We had breakfast every morning which included cereal, juice, lots of types of bread, cheese, ham, yoghurts and a choice of fruit. There was lots of everything and it was very tasty. Only little thing was that the orange juice wasn't real orange juice, more like a diluted drink. Other than that breakfast was great. The hotel was in a nice busy area with lots of other hotels and restaurants. We never had to walk more than 5 minutes for dinner any night...which suited me wearing heels on the cobbled streets! We were very pleased with the location as it was very near termini station and we used the metro a lot to get around so it was very convenient. However my only slight downside with the location would be that it is kind of the wrong side of termini in relation to all the sights so it would be quite a walk to some of them. I was afraid that the hotel would be a disappointment but I need not have worried. We had a terrific few days in the Astoria Garden Hotel and were thrilled at how reasonable the cost was!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: tampatraveler89
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good base for us. It was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. Rooms were small, (we had a quad) but in line with what is available for Rome. The bathroom was very clean and a good size. Our only problem was that it was a little far from the historic center. All the sites were within walking distance but at the end of a long day the walk was a bit much. The good thing is that it's not to far from Termini and all the trains and buses that go there. We bought the Roma pass and took full advantage of the public transportation back to the hotel at the end of the day. The buses are easy to use as well as the Metro. I was hesitant to book in the Termini area but found that this hotel was in a perfectly good neighborhood, even peaceful! Breakfast was good with meats, cheeses and a selection of breads and sweets.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back to this hotel tommorrow, if only I could!”
Reviews.Author: Ann-Nic
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our hotel choice. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Hotel smart and clean. Our room was somewhat small but we knew this on booking and importantly it was comfortable, clean and quiet with a good size shower. Breakfast good, my only critisism of our stay would be the orange juice was very watery - minor detail! The small garden was an added bonus for a quiet cup of tea or drink at the end of a tiring day sightseeing. Situated out of the hub of things but still within walking distance of plenty of the major sights and.convenient for the Terminni , and plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It is the Garden that makes it special.”
Reviews.Author: citroenbill
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels near Termini that can satisfy your needs for inexpensive accommodations within a fair price. The Astoria Garden however does this, but has a garden to add value to your stay. The rooms are smallish, but clean. The bat is well appointed, and not excessive.. but unlike other hotels in the Termini area... you go int the garden and enjoy the warmth of Rome with flowers and birds rather than stay in a small cramped room overlooking a busy street. There is a good size grocery store 1 block away for more than your basic needs (food, wine, beer, snacks and fruit etc), at local prices. The staff was very friendly with excellent English and helpful suggestions. I personally would stay here again in a heartbeat. If it were Winter and the garden not available, I am sure you could do as well elsewhere, but the opportunity to sit outside in a quiet lovely space made the hotel a special place for us.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sweddey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend in Rome. The hotel is very good placed close to Termini. However I think it would not ne hard to find a more comfortable hotel just as close to Termini as Astoria Garden hotel!! The hotel is very clean and fresh, I give them that. BUT the rooms are extremely small so is the bathrooms. Our weiv was out to a school covered in graffiti, very noisy. The beds must be made of bricks, they are horribly hard!!!!!!!!! The breakfast was HORRIBLE!! Croissants and bread that felt like they had been out for a week, teethbreakers. I am deffinately not a complainer, I am easy to please, but this was just too much!! Even at 7.00 on a Monday the bread was just as bad. I am sorry I would never go here again and i recommend you to look at a nearby hotel!!!!!! There are MANY around in the same neighbourhood!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: stoupagr
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Rome and want a reasonably priced hotel within a short walk from Termini, the train station, you can't go wrong with Astoria Garden. We stayed two nights in early May, 2009, and were very pleased. The staff is very friendly and helpful, particularly the delightful bellman who explained to us that the most important thing in life is amore (love). How right he is! Our room was clean, the bathroom was newly redone, and the bed comfortable. We asked for a room facing the garden and it was very quiet. The breakfast was good with lots of selection, including a cappuccino machine for morning coffee. There was a little fresh fruit (pineapple), but it was gone early and only canned peaches and prunes remained. That was the only little glitch in an otherwise ideal stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wexfordphil
Reviews.Content: Six of us, 3 couples stayed here in mid March and we all absolutely enjoyed our stay here. Check-in was very smooth and fast by the ever helpful receptionists. The rooms were as previous reviews have said are indeed on the small side but average really for Europe; they were spotlessly clean and were cleaned and towels etc. replienished each day we were there. Shower was excellent too. Breakfast, a buffet continental style of cheeses hams breads etc was more than adequate. the receptionists were really marvellous and were able to assist with any query we had including bus routes, restaurants etc. As a bonus there is a really pretty garden in the hotel with seating areas. Locationwise this hotel is perfect being only 3 minutes walk from Rome's central station called Termini. There ar some great restaurants nearby and we spent a night or 2 in a pub nearby called The Yellow Bar which was lively and very reasonable by Rome standards. Rome is a great city and is my second time there and hopefully i will be back again and would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the central location and staff warmth”
Reviews.Author: bhromonpagol
Reviews.Content: Very central location, 5 min walk from Termini. Helpful staff willing to assist and rooms though small were very quiet which is very special in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Garden Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveller61Miami
Reviews.Content: After been given the run around by Hotel Galatea, we were pleasantly surprised by the Astoria Garden Hotel a comfortable pleasant Hotel only 4 blocks from the Termini where you can get all the tourist sightseeing buses and trains. This hotel seems like a small oasis in the sea of sandstone & concrete in the city of Rome. The service was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was buffet continental style but plenty to choose from. Whilst there try Mama Angelos Restorante in block behind Hotel, the food and service was great, you may have to wait for table but it is worth it, beware portions are large.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaMc_8
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel so much. The staff on the desk went out of their way to help me with all sorts of information various things. Nothing was too much problem. Room small as per Rome standards. Garden area a real bonus and handly location but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Termini station. Would have no hesitation in staying at Astoria Garden again.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: TexBecks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 weeks ago. We got what we paid for: a clean place to sleep and shower. The location is a short walk from Termini, so it's great for travelers who are just stopping in Rome for a short time. The front desk staff were very helpful, and we even had a porter help us with our bags. The room wasn't especially large or comfortable. The lighting was very dim, and the beds were rock hard--this was the major drawback of the room. The bathroom was a generous size for European hotels and had all the toiletries that we needed. Breakfast was your standard European breakfast fare: bread, cheese, meats, yogurt, fruit, juice, and coffee. It was a decent place to stay for one night, but if our stay had been longer, I would've looked elsewhere for a more comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but more like 2.5 star”
Reviews.Author: LordoBristol
Reviews.Content: This is mostly what you'd expect from a 3-star hotel. Some little things let it down though which is why I suggest it's more lke 2.5-star. At popular showering times the hot water can get cold, and some of the room furniture is worn/broken which doesn't really matter but it's just a bit irritating (shower door not quiet closing properly, handles on cupboards all loose). Staff very helpful. Continental cold breakfast is as you'd expect aside from the dilutable orange juice which was a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Central location ,Good value”
Reviews.Author: BDHwindsor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights ,good price ,helpful staff and good sized room.Breakfast in lower level ok but not much choice.Rooms a bit worn but kept clean.Will stay again when in Rome next.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Hellpful Staff, Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: steelptn
Reviews.Content: We booked this 3 star hotel because it was within walking distance to the Roma Termini (the main Train Station in Rome), which allowed us to use the Station to use trains to go other places, as well as catch the Metro (subway, sort of) This is the train station you arrive at from the Rome Airport. Once you arrive at the Roma Termini Station, you need to walk approximately 1/4 to 1/2 mile to get to this hotel. We arrived at the door of the hotel at 9:00 in the morning. The staff was very welcoming and got us into our room right away. This is unheard of when arriving to a hotel in the United States. You are lucky if you can get your room before 2:00 in the afternoon. The hotel grounds and rooms are spotless. The hotel staff spoke English and were so very helpful explaining where to catch a bus to get anywhere in Rome. The place to catch the bus (No. 492) was less then a block away. If you miss it, no big deal, another comes within 15 minutes or less. The hotel is a 3 star. The only difference I noticed between the 4 star hotels we stayed at in different towns throughout italy, is that there is no mini-refrigerator in the room, and no internet point at the hotel. But there is a very nice internet point just a block or two away, so it was no big deal to go there an check my email for 1 Euro per 1/2 hour. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful. They always had fresh melon, the freshest Italian crusty rolls, the tastiest cheese slices, salami and ham slices. Three choices of cereals, including muesli, and an assortment of yogurt single serving cups. Also an assortment of sweet breads and juices. The ONLY BAD THING I can say about this place, is instead of the Breakfast Room attendant offering to make you a cappucino, they only have some sort of an automated machine, that makes the cappacino and it is awful. So, after breakfast we would walk 1/2 a block and for 1 Euro we would buy our cappacino. You will read on the internet, to stay away from hotels near the Train Station, because they are "seedy". This absolutely is not true. When looking at a Map of Rome, our hotel was located strraight up from the picture of the station - just go to Google Maps, and map out Astoria Garden Hotel, Rome, Italy. We walked the area, even at night (we are a couple in our 50's) and never felt threatened in anyway. We used our heads, however, and are always aware of our surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “ok, not great, avoid single room”
Reviews.Author: Alceste
Reviews.Content: Basically, a decent hotel, professional service. clean, well kept. But: -no mini-bar - I made the mistake of ordering a "single" room, rather than a double room w/ single occupancy. That room was tiny. The price difference with double room single occupancy was not large, I think. I should have known better, - the Garden is pleasant enough to pass through, but not really a place where you can sit and relax, it has a very crowded feeling , and the metal chairs are quite uncomfortable - breakfast was basic, as is usually the case in Italy, but the coffee came from some dreary machine that produced something that was almost but not entirely unlike coffee. What's could be the point of staying in Rome if the morning cuppa is terrible?

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT stay for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeachbum
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of the previous reviews and this was one of the reasons I booked the Astoria Garden, but it was not all it cracked up to be. We needed to take a very early flight and the room was ready when we arrived. This was fine and what was expected as we did arrive by 11am. We went to get some lunch and came back two and a half hours later but unfortunately the room still wasn't ready. We sat down and read for another half an hour but was really tired by this time. When we got to the room, I was shocked and how tiny this room was. All I can say is the previous reviews must have been based on suprior rooms only. It was explained to me this was a standard double and this is what I booked. This was the only room offered on the website and yet the pictures provided were of a much larger room. I work as a travel agent and would class this room as a single. There is a double bed of the smallest kind but there is only about one and a half feet around the bed and a wardrobe pushed up against it. You cant put your suitcase flat on the floor as there is not enough room. If we had had a suitcase each we would have needed to keep one in reception. I tried the shower after this and I barely managed to fit. I am of average size. If you are on the large side, you will have a lot of trouble in the shower, there wasnt a bath at all. So again very tiny. Also After laying on the bed which was extremely hard, I wanted to see how thick the mattress was because it didnt feel any thicker than a couple of inches on wooden planks but unfortunately it was about 6 inches thick, but very uncomfortable. We both decided we couldnt stay in this room. We asked to pay for any upgrade but there werent any rooms available so we looked for another hotel. We found the Bellini Bristol for 200 euros a night. Double the price i know but quadruple the quality. We checked out that night and I was charged for one nights stay but on the return I found I had a very rude e-mail telling me that they had debited my card with another night. Again this is fine but I could have done without the rudeness. I suppose the moral of the story is you get what you pay for and if you want to stay here please make sure you have what they call a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again when we come back to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Spartan24
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 night stay here, in August 2008. The staff were brilliant, from keeping our luggage an extra half day after we’d booked out to recommending great restaurants for the evenings- very friendly and professional. The two rooms we had were great, both had en-suite facilities and beautifully furnished and clean. They both had safes, air conditioning (essential in August) and tv’s. Breakfast was provided and there was plenty to choose from. The hotel is in easy walking distance from the train station which made it perfect for us. We’d definately recommend this hotel- we threw our coins into the Trevi Fountain to make sure we come back to Rome, and when we do, we'll be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: OscarTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: Astoria Hotel is easily found just 5 minutes walk from Termini station - Very handy! After a simple check in the porter showed us to our room.
