He was a very friendly man and told us that we had a "very romantic room" He was right we had a room on the ground floor over looking the well kept gardens, The room was well presented, clean and tidy and had a modern bathroom. Breakfast was served downstairs and was also very well done. We thoroughly recommend for people staying in this area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's answer to Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: BasilFawltyLondonUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way back to London because of the relatively high ratings here, and because of the proximity to the station (we had previously stayed at Ambra Palace Golden Tulip when we first arrived in Italy). What a mistake. If you have watched Fawlty Towers this will be very familiar to you! Apart from the convenience of being centrally located, the facilities were sub-standard. The room we stayed in (204) was small and the bathroom and toilet (separate) were each tiny. The view thruogh the window was of a disused University building across the street, covered in graffiti. The bath had a jacuzzi in it (which Ambra Palace did too). Unfortunately it did not work and we reported this to reception. The receptionist (who seemed terrified of the owner) commented that the jacuzzi was "delicate". I am still not entirely sure what he meant by this. Nevertheless, we were warned not to use shampoo etc. etc. This was not a particularly big deal for us, but he notified the management anyway. The owner called me in the room and said that I would be "stupid" to expect the jacuzzi to work at the rates that I was paying (about £75 per night), and that anyway it would be a waste of 90 litres of water! He said he would be happy to charge me another 30 Euros if I really wanted to use it. I did not think it worthwhile arguing with him about this and did not discuss it further. The air-conditioning was just about OK (it took about 3 hours for the room to cool down to a modestly comfortable temperature but it was still not particularly comfortable). My wife was bitten by insects in the room overnight (large red spots on the skin). It is worth taking a look at some other reports here to verify that this is a common problem at this hotel. Breakfast was a hilarious affair. Immediately upon checking in, we were warned in no uncertain terms that removing unconsumed food from the breafast area was strictly forbidden. At breakfast, we were watched like a hawk by a surly matron-like attendant whose roles seemed to be to prevent guests from consuming too much food. We have relatively small appetites, but one young chap who was consuming a healthy portion was told off for eating too much! Food was swiftly removed from the serving area if 'too much' was being taken! Breakfast itself was very basic. There was no hot/cooked food - not even toast. Our advice would be to avoid this place if you can. Stay at Ambra Palace instead - for a similar price, you will get a much larger well-decorated room, a proper cooked breakfast, polite and helpful staff and facilities that work.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner010
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I really liked this hotel. When we arrived the staff were fantastic. We were in one of the garden rooms and i would highly recommend this. As it was our honeymoon they brought us champagne. The room wasn't large but it was a descent size. It was very clean and tidy with no bedbugs. The staff were really helpful in giving information and booking a tour to Pompei for us. The breakfast was continental and was the best out of all the hotels we stayed at on out honeymoon for it's selection. The location is great, it's close to buses and the metro but on a little side street so you don't get the traffic noise. Some of the restaurants in the area were fantastic. There is an internet place up the street, As it was extremely hot while we were there, the air conditioning was great and worked really well. It would cool our room down very quickly. The area around the hotel was safe and we could walk around at night with no concerns. We stayed here for 6 days and if i was to go back to Roma i would stay here again. The front desk staff are all English speaking which was very helpful for us. I think there is supposed to be a restaurant at the hotel but it was not open during our stay. I think the only thing to improve our room would have been a mini fridge. I think this hotel is an excellent value for the money and i would recommend it. It was a lovely hotel and room to start off our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart53
Reviews.Content: Great staff on duty 24 hours a day & nothing was too much trouble. They all spoke very good English which was a huge help! The whole place was very clean. I would stay here again but will book a garden room next time as the small enclosed garden was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: evelynyeager
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Astoria Garden. It was an excellent hotel. The room was good size, the bed was comfortable and the desk people were very helpful. They had a free European breakfast which was very nice. Our room had a little balcony overlooking the garden which was nice. The hotel was located near the bus line which made easy access to all the major sites. There are several nice resturants near the hotel as well, even a laudromat down the street (which we needed). The TV had one English channel. The only "problem" is parking was only available was on the street and no Internet -but for the price, quality and location, it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for going in and out of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: suzt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between our 10 day stay on Amalfi Coast and our early morning plane ride out of Rome. The hotel was decent, and only a 4 block walk from Termini, but the front desk staff was very rude. He gave us very incorrect information and was nasty on top of it! Breakfast was decent. If you're using the hotel like we did - it's fine, but go somewhere else if it's not for commuting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Garden at Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Chelle64
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay. Close to the train station(Termini) Easy to catch public transportation. Nice restaurants nearby. The staff was the best part of my stay. Really genuine & helpful! Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: polastar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night and it was as I expected, cheap, clean, a good breakfast, close to the termini in an area that was not to scary. I would stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “All we needed”
Reviews.Author: braq24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astoria Garden Hotel on our first trip to Italy. It was a our first stop after landing. The place is real nice inside. The rooms are very tiny, which is usually the case anywhere. The breakfasts were buffets..Coffee, yogurt, bread, etc. Easily filled up enough to take us through a good part of the morning. The staff are all great...They took our suitcases upon arriving and brought them to our room while we checked in. They also hold your key for you when you leave, which was one less thing we had to worry about. The reception is there 24 hours a day, so there was never an issue with the key. For all those who don't know Italian, no worries here - Everyone spoke perfect English. We also had a nice view of the garden outside, which was nice. It's close to the Termini in a quiet neighborhood. To traveling students, make sure you take advantage of the student discount when you book. We found out about it after we booked and they were not able to give it to us upon arriving since we prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Astoria Garden. Its perfectly positioned for the Termini and a short walk into the centre of Rome. We got a warm greeting when we arrived and our cases carried to our room which was one of the garden rooms. The room looked as though it had been recently built and although small was spotlessly clean and kept that way during our stay. The bathroom was very modern with only a shower. Breakfast was ham, cheese, prosciuto, cereal, fruit, croissants, and a choice of pastries. It was all self-service as was the tea/coffee. No complaints about the breakfast at all. The only negative was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but I understand thats quite common in Rome. Apart from that the hotel was great. We tended to eat around the Piazza Barberini and found a great restaurant just down from there called Restorante Piscipiano "Gioia Mia". The food was great and so was the price. We also ate in "Thats Amore" which was just across the road from the Gioia Mia. The food was great but this was a bit pricier but it was a more modern classier restaurant. After dinner each night we sat outside Pepys Bar in Piazza Barberini, under the patio heaters, watching the world go by. Thoroughly recommend this hotel and the restaurants/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start our vacation”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers5051
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived exhausted and overwhelmed to the Hotel Astoria Gardens in the early hours (7 :30 AM )of our trip. While we could not go directly to our room, they stored our luggage for us and gave us directions and helpful advice for seeing Rome. Our room was nice and clean. I am a freak about bugs and am always on the lookout. I did not see any bugs. Nor did we experience any bedbugs. The hotel is a short walk around the corner from the Termini Station and just one block from the supermarket. We purchased some deli meat and cheese, beer and Levissima water (which I found much like US water). Just at the end of the street our hotel was on is a great restaurant. Rather contemporary and served good food. It is also across the street from an internet point. 1 Euro for an hour. Even after my adapter/converter melted my appliance and threw the breaker, they were kind and suggested a new converter. We bought one from them, which they sold without markup, and we used it for the rest of our trip without incicent. All and all we would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Polite, looks like a clean hotel but bed bugs were true”
Reviews.Author: Sorsue
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The staff are really nice and the breakfast is good compared to the other breakfasts I had at other hotels in Italy. There are more choices here e.g. yogurt, fruits, etc. I stayed at 201..room is small but I think its the same everywhere else in Italy..price is good. It looks really clean. My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights in November. Everything seems fine until the 3rd night.....we were just sitting on the bed looking at the map, figuring where to go the next day, my husband suddenly start hitting his leg...he killed a bug which was crawling upwards from his ankle. The bug had blood in it...I took a look at it and yes, its the bed bug. I wanted to change room desperately but my husband refuses to do so because 1) it would be a hassle to repack and unpack again...2) the other rooms might be even worse. We inspected the bed, flipped the pillows and the blankets, checked the bedsheets and the floor, no more bed bugs.....so (with my husband's persuasion,saying that the maid probably had brought it in but there's really no bugs in this room), we decided to just stick with the room. My husband had been stung by wasps, and bees before so he felt that bedbugs are really nothing....while I have very sensitive skin, I couldn't sleep at all the 3rd night....I requested the lights to be on so I can wake up and check to make sure....I probably have woken up every hour to check the bed...I even wrapped myself up by wearing long socks, holding onto my sleeves when sleeping...the next morning, I don't seem to find any bites on my body so I figure it is okay to stay in the same room. But I made sure that my luggage was not on the bed...however, my husband book bag was on it....I was so mad...but before I left, I flipped the bag inside out and checked my luggage, making sure that I would not be carrying these bugs back with me. Well, the 4th night at this hotel, was a little better...i slept more but still woke up to double check...no bites as well. So overall, this is a good deal but that one bed bug is really a problem. I should have told the hotel staff...but didn't remember to do so....and as per the other review, i am sure that they have heard similar complaints before. Hopefully, I haven't brought any home...but I am still very paranoid...because after staying at Rome, I went to Florence for 3 nights, then Venice for 2 nights...after returning home, the 2nd night back at home, I found bite marks 2 -3 bites across my hand and arms that just started to swell and itch...i googled these bite marks and found them very similar to bed bug bites....now I am worrying whether I brought any home....I started to disinfect the whole house, rewash everything, inspect my bed...seems okay... See the thing is, I don't know if these bites were from this hotel or from the Florence hotel, or the Venice hotel...as per google, the victim may not know about the bites until some time later....but I can't seem to believe that these bites may have taken some 8-10 days to show up...so I am hoping that I have gotten bitten in Venice and that I did not bring any bugs home =X. My suggestion to you is that if you don't care about bugs and $$ is more important, then this hotel is not bad - then go ahead and take a risk (of taking them back with you home)....other than that, I really wanted to give this hotel better than average ratings but I personally really hate bugs and my skin is too sensitive to risk it....I regret not changing hotel when I found that bug on my husband's leg. If I did, I probably would not have been so paranoid...still paranoid. (Also, my husband found bites on his elbow, 2-3 bites across on the 4 night after the trip???)

Reviews.Title: “A decent little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WestonSaint
Reviews.Content: We arranged for a 7 day stay and were not disappointed. The hotel is only about 10 minutes walk from Termini Station and there is a very good half hour Express train from the Airport (about 35 mins) to Termini. We stayed on the 3rd floor and as previous reviewers have stated the rooms are small but very clean and well decorated. The breakfast was OK. The staff were excellent and the reception desk people all spoke good English. The Porter was always helpful. A Trattoria Restaurant was recommended by the hotel and was excellent. Food was good, staff efficient and well drilled at affordable prices. We are very selective of our hotels in England but would happily rate this Italian one in the average/above average range for a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: mzak66
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Astoria Garden 25.8.-29.8.2007. We booked this hotel because it had good ratings, especially for cleanliness. Our room 309 on the third floor was obviously quite recently renovated and our first impression was positive. The problems started, however, almost immediately. Especially my girlfriend started to scratch herself everywhere. Later she got big red spots which were constanly itching. At first we couldn't figure out what it was, at this point I didn't have any problems yet. Only on the third morning we saw an insect on our sheet and instinctively killed it. The insect had blood in it. So we checked our bed, I turned one of the pillows and there it was, a big brown insect. I took the whole pillow with me and showed it to the guy at the reception. He killed the insect immediately and explained that this was really the first time and this insect came probably from the street or from the garden. He also promised us to have another room, which we got. We were not quite happy, but having paid in advance we accepted their offer and hoped for the best. The new room was really small and in such a bad condition, that we asked for a bigger room the following day. We got one on the first floor and moved in, only to find the same type of insect again. Now we checked the Internet and found out that it was the bedbug (Cimex lectularius, in German Bettwanze). At this point we didn't trust the staff any more and decided to leave. We asked the staff to give us our money back for the remaing days (we were supposed to stay one week), but they refused of course. We were lucky to find a room in Hosianum Palace Hotel for the next two nights and in Trilussa Palace for our last night in Rome. These hotels were ok, but our long awaited holiday was largely spoiled. It is obvious that there are bedbugs all over the hotel. We were tempted to talk about the issue with the other guests, but decided not to, as we didn't want to spoil anyone's holiday. Why didn't the others then have the same problem? we were wondering about this, but later read that most people do not even realize that they have bugs as they hardly get any symptoms. Only the more sensitive ones (like my poor girlfriend) get more infected and the bites itch constantly. With bad luck, choosing this hotel you not only suffer from the bedbug problem during your trip, but also might carry the bugs home in your suitcase. We cannot recommend Astoria Garden Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but staff could be a little obstructive”
Reviews.Author: Setch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my elderly parents. Good location, close to bus station, railway station and sightseeing buses.On arrival the porter was eager to please but kept following us around, opening doors trying to carry things (for a tip) The desk misplaced my passport and virtually accused ME of losing it. It was found some hours later (they did apologise) When asked to book a certain taxi firm (the one we had had good service from at the airport) we were told that they could not book taxis. Later a different member of staff did book one for us. My single room was very small and dark and overlooked a school which was quite noisy around 8am. My parents room was nice and overlooked the small garden. Both rooms had air conditioning and the cleaning staff were excellent.The breakfast was the normal continental kind but was adequate. To sum up I would say this is a 3 star hotel - would I stay again ? yes in a double room, no in a single room

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KazMeath
Reviews.Content: Well what a nice hotel. Centrally situated to Termini Station. The hotel is clean, maid service every day. Fresh towels left each time. Our room was out through the little garden. Small room but comfortable with adequate bathroom. Air-conditioning was a bonus as it was on average 23c every day. You are in Rome and there is so much to see & do that your not going to be sitting in your room a whole lot anyway. The Breakfast was fine, the usual continental serving croissants, breads, cheese, salami, cereals, fruit etc. Breakfast was until 10am. The Bar is small and we actually never sat it in once but did buy a beer. It was EUR5 for a can of German beer. The staff in the hotel where all very courteous. We did find that you had to leave your key at reception but most hotels normally have this policy. The one & only drawback about this hotel was the dreaded erratic showers!! The temperature was all over the place and it was annoying but you get over it. Try have the temperature increased to start with, then it doesn't go so cold!! On Rome itself. I was so looking forward to our visit and I was not disappointed. The train journey from the airport is about 45 mins and is EUR11 per person. Green line tours was the bus we choose. EUR20 each for a 48 hr ticket. We timed it that we got our ticket at 2pm on the Monday so it meant we had up until 2pm Wednesday to use the bus. The commentary on this tour was brutal however. We passed loads of interesting looking buildings & sights and nothing was said about any of it. If your using the underground it is EUR1 per ticket & this will last you for 75mins, also EUR4 for a day ticket. St Peters itself is free of charge like all churches in Rome. It is spectacular! Queue's can be very long but move quick. Best time to go is early afternoon about 2pm. You have to be covered up though. Shoulders, Knees & ankles (for men) have to be covered. Vatican Museum & Sistine chapel. We went about 11am & had to queue about an hour. Again if you go about 1pm there is little or no queue. They say it closes 4.45 but entrance actually closes about 3.15pm as they reckon it takes about 1 hour 30 mins to complete. Price in there is EUR13. Again worth it but would advise to perhaps get a tour guide if you have a few Euro to spare. Colesseum & Roman forum was the highlight for us. We got a guide for this and it was a total of EUR20 per person. We got to skip the queue and get a quick history lesson. Very interesting. Roman forum was also great & would really recommend a guide. We had a guy from the UK & he was brilliant. Really knew his history & was very interesting, we actually did the walking tour of Rome with him aswell. The walking tour is EUR20pp & lasts about 2.5hrs. Trevi Fountain is lovely spot aswell but is known for pick pocketing so keep your bags, wallets etc to the front. Eating out in Rome - we where told to judge most restaurants but the cost of the Margherita Pizza. If it costs EUR5 or less it is a reasonable priced place to eat. Anything over EUR6.50 and they are charging tourist prices. There are very few pubs! Most places are Bars but they are like cafe bars. A beer can be anything from EUR6 to EUR7.50 & that's local beer. You'll see alot of like mobile shops at all the main tourist attractions. They are expensive but convenient. A bottle of sprite is EUR4 & water EUR2. Try some nearby shops where a bottle of water can be as little as EUR0.60.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Astoria Garden”
Reviews.Author: Murko
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend (now wife to be - since visiting Europe!) and I stayed at this hotel for several nights during July 2007. Not having travelled to Rome before, we used Tripadvisor to help select a hotel with the following important features: 1) value for money 2) clean 3) good airconditioning 4) located in a safe & central area We found the hotel to be excellent. Yes, the room was very small, and required a little bit of juggling with a couple of large suitcases, but who sits in their room for more than a quick break and to sleep? In addition, although the hotel is located only a few blocks from Roma termini, the street was very quiet and windows seem to be double glazed (quiet!). The bathroom was also small, but appeared to be recently refurbished and worked well. As identified in previous posts, the water temperature in the shower did fluctuate a bit, however i didnt find it to be too much of a problem. I must agree with all earlier comments on the breakfast. Very simple, however great for a start to the day with fruit drink, cereals, toast, fruit, some sliced meat and cheese, coffee and some very basic pastries. For the price we paid for the room, this came as a nice inclusion. Our experience with the staff was good. They booked us in for the tours we wanted to go on (Vatican etc) while we waited at reception and generally had good english to assist us. We only have a couple of small negatives on the hotel: 1) Maid service for the room seemed to occur very late in the day - well after lunch on at least one occassion. We often popped back in for a rest around this time and would have appreciated it being complete. 2) When checking into the hotel, we were required to provide ID (passports - both of us!). While I dont have a problem with showing these and letting them quickly record our passport numbers for security reasons, they insisted on keeping them to verify for an hour or two. Not sure what this was about.....? Overall, we were extremely happy with the standard provided at Astoria Garden Hotel! Murko

Reviews.Title: “Controlling and Strange”
Reviews.Author: Teech34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and were surprised at the very controlling nature of the staff. Before I explain what I mean, let me first say that the room which was on the first floor in the garden area, was fairly clean but had a strange odor that was a bit unsettling. Anyway, when we got there they gave us our key and there was a guy that escorted us to our room. This "guy" was like the do-it-all minion (nice, but a little too up in our business all the time). Upon checking in, we immediatley wanted to go sightseeing. As we were walking out of the front door, they halted us and said, "Excuse me, we need to hold onto your key... it is safer that way". We kind of looked at the desk guy in disbelief... and as my husband reluctantly handed over our hotel key; I became reminded of some 1940's movie... where the unsuspecting Americans didn't realize the owners of the hotel were fascist. Anyway, when we came back we had to ask them for our key and luckily, they gave it to us no problem. My husband saw a short cut through the bar area that seemed a little quicker path to our room and as we were headed to the door they yelled at us and told us we had to go around and that we were not to use that door. Strange. The next morning proved stranger. We went to breakfast and since my husband and I smoke we wanted to eat our breakfast outside in the very lovely garden. Nope! No can do; apparently, the only way you can eat outside is if you pay for your food and order it from outside. We were reprimanded once again, but for this time... trying to take our food outside. I was starting to feel like a child at this point. Needless to say, we were very anxious to go sightseeing. Yes, we had to drop off our key each time. Anyway, when we came back to the room the maid had been there and I was shocked. The room was clean, but she or he had taken some of my things and Put Them In Back in My Suitcase!!! Overall, if you don't mind feeling like a child and having your things rifled through... than please feel free to stay at the Astoria Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: jz52
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware- we stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our trip no problems nice hotel nice garden nice balcony, ok breakfast, close to train station and other transport to explore Rome, good price- BUT- on our last leg of our trip we booked it again for two nights and when we got there were told that there was a plumbing problem- we heard this story already three times in Italy hotels (an obvious overbooking lie)- we were taken to a sister hotel apparently of equal statue- having stayed at the Astoria before i emmediately knew the hotel we got was a dump compared to Astria- this was our final two days and we decided not to get angry and too focused on this and instead focused on our time out of the dumpy hotel- SO Buyer beware the Astria lies and overboooks- be careful when booking- if you get it great youll like it- if not expect a poor quality hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter25001
Reviews.Content: I would give it four and a half out of five if I could, it was only let down by a couple of mistakes the staff made. The Hotel is close enough to the centre of Rome to be easily accessible yet far enough out so that the price is affordable. The staff were very friendly and helpful BUT dont let them book a limousine for you and don't trust the restaurant reccomendations! If your looking for a budget hotel that is a good base for your exploration of Rome this is it. The Hotel was clean and the room was small (Apparently most hotel rooms in rome are small) but practical and had the facilities that we expected, including air conditioning which we could not have survived without as it was soo hot outside. If we go back to Rome we will stay there again. We asked at the front desk if they new a local restaurant. Oops! they recommended the one around the corner that they get 10% discount from. Dont bother it took the staff half an hour to take our a couple of Italian guys came in and were eating their second course before we had even got our wine. The food was below average and the staff were not interested. They managed to reduce their tip by half and I rarely leave a small tip. We decided to splash out and get a Limousine to collect us from the airport which only cost E5 more than a taxi, so we were collected by a nice guy in a black air conditioned Mercedes. We had not however reserved it for the return trip. Half way through our stay we decided to get the same limousine company to take us back, so I asked at the hotel reception if they could organise this for us. They said yes no problem but suggested they could get us a better company for the same price, I should have insisted on the company we had used before. When our "transport" arrived it was not a nice black airconditioned limousine it was a mini bus which we ended up sharing with two other people from the hotel next door. I know Italian drivers are lunatics so expected the ride to be a little exciting, what I didn't expect was for us to strap ourselves in with the seatbelts very tightly to ensure that the seat did not slide into the seat in front!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_with_son
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Astoria Garden Hotel in mid-July with my son and my husband. Overall, we were very happy with our choice. The rooms are indeed very small (think jail cell small), but we were not in Rome to hang out in our hotel room so it just wasn't an issue for us. The bathroom was spotlessly clean with beautiful updated tile and the in-room safe was a nice touch. A few issues that we had with the hotel. We put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door the first few day, however every day the hotel staff came in and cleaned our room. We put the sign on the door because we had all of our travel information out and the room didn't need to be cleaned anyway (I don't change my sheets at home everyday!). The sign was removed and the room was thoroughly cleaned. I appreciate the clean room, however I think they should respect the sign. What if we were trying to sleep? The breakfast was also pretty skimpy. The lady that worked at the breakfast every morning tried her best to make the most out of what they had (she fanned the few pieces of cheese in a nice pattern, etc.) However, fresh rolls would have been much nicer. There were also tables available every time we went, which was nice. Hint: They seem to take the fresher rolls out later. Maybe they use up yesterday's leftovers first? Other then these two, relatively minor, issues, we really did enjoy the hotel and would definitely stay there again. Our room overlooked the gardens out back, and we never heard any noise at night. Every night, my husband and I enjoyed a bottle of wine in the garden while my son slept upstairs. The staff was helpful with directions and recommendations and spoke perfect English. The owner of the hotel was a little grumpy, but he wasn't there very often and he clearly took great pride in his beautiful hotel. Make sure before you go that you know exactly where the hotel is. Even though it really is just a few blocks to Termini station, the station is huge with countless exits and the street names and numbers in Rome are meaningless. We arrived at Termini with the address and ended up wandering with all of our luggage for an hour before we finally just paid a cab to take us to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: sfvisitor
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, the desk manager had problems locating our reservation. We showed him our Orbitz voucher, but he claimed the reservation was not in the computer. "Luckily," he said, "you can stay at our sister hotel as a backup. You don't have to pay extra." Pay extra for what? The sister hotel, Hotel Select, was no gem. We were very disappointed that we had done lots of research and diligently booked the room five months early, only to end up somewhere we considered inferior.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff at the Astoria Garden”
Reviews.Author: gmanssa
Reviews.Content: Located walking distance from the Termini train station, Astoria Garden's staff was very helpful. However, the rooms were tiny. Excellent A/C however and the room was clean. Breakfast was fair. I didn't love the location as the train station is not very centrally located in terms of the historical sites and better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hawiiansky
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday present from my boyfriend so i didnt really know what to expect from the place. We arrived at the hotel and had a nice gentleman take are luggages to our room. He was very kind. The receptonist was really helpfull and nice as well. They always helped us with things we wanted to know about Rome and how far the tourist attractions were to the hotel. He supplied us with maps so we knew where we were going. The top thing about this hotel is the location. It was close to the termani and the buses. We were able to get to all the tourist attractions from here. Only fault i would say is the hotel showers. The hot and cold taps don't work properly. The temperature of the water was constantly changing. It isn't a majour fault thou. Overall though i think it is a lovely hotel and i would return there to stay if i went back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - decent value - small rooms - horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dctravelWashington
Reviews.Content: I had booked another hotel in Rome through the website Venere.com -- I am not certain if it was a problem on the website or hotel's side of things but they were already booked and yet allowed my reservation to go through. A day after I received an email from the original hotel stating the problem and telling me that they had re-booked me at the Astoria Garden which was another one of their properties in Rome. After a quick check with Tripadvisor I agreed to go along with the change rather than look for different accommodations. As far as location in Rome this hotel is very well situated very close (walking distance) from the main Termini Station in Rome in what seems to be a very safe area and far enough off of a main street to keep noise levels down. There is a school across the street from the entrance that could be a bit noisy in the mornings (the graffiti all over the school building's front was quit eye-opening as well). I read another review that notes to request rooms that look onto the garden/ palms rather than the street - I would agree. The room (a double) is on the small side -- but seemed clean and neat for the most part. The bathroom was clean. We did find the water temperature in the bathroom to be very annoying as it shifted constantly through three 20-second long cycles during the morning shower -- cold - scalding hot - freezing. That did make the start of each day less enjoyable during the stay. The front desk personnel were very helpful with directions and advice throughout our stay and they spoke excellent English that help compensate for our poor Italian skills. Other amenities include a garden/bar area that could be a relaxing place to sit -- but time was not a luxury for us on this trip. I will have to say that we were very very disappointed with the breakfast offered by the hotel. This was our fifth hotel during the trip and by far the worst accommodations when it came to the breakfast. The hostess was very cold and uninviting -- the offering as far as food was not much in the way of appealing -- and the biggest shock to us was that in the country of wonderful coffee options this hotel offered their coffee and espressos from a vending type machine -- which just tasted horrible. We actually skipped the breakfast the final two days because it just was not worth the time. If they fix the water temperature problems in the shower this hotel is a pretty good deal (even with the bad breakfast offerings).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0123
Reviews.Content: The Astoria Garden is a lovely hotel. We were blessed to be assigned a room right off the garden. It was picture perfect. It was also clean and neat. The hotel staff were very nice and tried to help us with whatever we needed. We don't think we will ever get back to Rome, but if we did...we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location close to train station”
Reviews.Author: nobley
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on a small side street a short walk from the main Termini Station. We chose this hotel because all the Hotels closer to the Station were reviewed as being noisy from traffic and had a problem with homeless people and gypsy's. This was true. The main street is literally amassed with tourist buses, taxis, cars & motor bikes all day and night long. Rome never stops 24/7. The Garden Astoria is only a small hotel but it is very neat, clean, and being set back on a side street feels almost like a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle. There are quite a number of steps at the front entrance. Our triple room was smallish with two singles pushed together as the double and a separate single bed. We were on the ground floor next to the reception desk but noise was not a problem. There were window shutters if needed. There was a school/ TAFE across the road that was bit noisy as the students stood under our window and chatted waiting for the school to open. But we were usually up ourselves by then and it didn't bother us. The bathroom was smallish but new and functional. In the shower there is a string with like a red plastic bit on it- don't pull it. it is the alarm. We thought it operated an exhaust fan. There is no exhaust fan so It can be a bit steamy. And if there was one it didn't operate effectively. The remote TV was bit small for the room and set high on the wall. There was a desk and one chair. There was an oil heater in the room and bathroom which must have been on a timer as they were either really really hot or not working at all. We requested extra blankets which staff got straight away. There were no tea and coffee making facilities. You can buy coffee from numerous cafes nearby, approx 2 euro if you stand at the counter or a ridiculous 4.50 euro if you sit - thats EACH. And the coffee was lousy. We couldn't wait to get back to Australia for a decent Cafe Latte. The Hotel also offers a small sitting area and bar witha lovely Garden of palms & fruit trees. The breakfast room was downstairs and offered a small self serve buffet of basic pastries, cold meats, cheese, friut etc. This was best if you arrived early as later in the morning the choices became quite limited. The orange juice was actually cordial and the coffee was just okay. You could eat as much as you liked. You need to leave your key at reception on leaving the hotel at anytime. It meant we couldn't lose it I suppose. A lot of smaller hotels in Europe like you to leave the key at the reception. Our 5 night stay at this hotel was great. The location was good because after the very busy days sightseeing it was lovely to return to a quiet haven. Generally we were able to walk/hike to all the main sights except Vatican city. Otherwise the metro is literally 5mins away. Watch out for pickpockets-and especially don't travel during peak times. There are numerous restaurants nearby but the best was a pizza restaurant across the road from the termini. Roman pizza is like flat bread with hardly any topping and pretty greasy. We learnt to look for pizza places with an actual woodfire oven and ask for extra toppings. There is a supermarket within 5 mins walk to get bottled water, fruit, toiletries etc. There is no internet access at the hotel but up the street a laundromet - offers internet use at a charge per hr. The reception staff are all very helpful and speak English. The Doorman is so helpful. He is the Uncle of one of the owners and he will bend over backwards to help. I don't know whether he wanted a tip or not but we gave him one anyway. I don't know whether he speaks English either but he smiles alot. The hotel would not be the same without him. This hotel offers good value for money, close to the railway station and a nice family feel. Request a room that looks onto the garden/ palms rather than the steet. Look on the hotels own web site before booking- sometimes offer better deal!

Reviews.Title: “I'd make this homebase again”
Reviews.Author: DMMICKEY
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Rome - we had a blast! The hotel is in the perfect location - close enough to the Termini - but not too close. Easy enough to find by cab - as long as you know what street it's on or Piazza Independenza. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The odd thing was that we had to turn in our room key before we went out for the day, but we figure it was because the key has the hotel name and room number on it, and if you lose it... The room was small (compared to NJ/NY standards) - but it's Europe and everyone tells me that all of the rooms are small. We even had a stage in our room - not really sure what it was for, but it was cute. And the shower was GREAT - great pressure, great temperature!! The garden was beautiful, I only wish I was taller so I could have picked some of the oranges. If I had to find a downside to this hotel, it would be the school directly across the street, only because you hear the kids when they're outside in the morning. But that didn't really bother us. I would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jollybee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astoria Garden for 2 nights in February. The hotel is in a central location, very close to the Termini station from which both lines of the Rome underground link and from where you can catch buses and trains to many tourist attractions and beyond (including both aiports). The hotel was exceptionally clean and the staff were very helpful. The service provided by them was above that of which you would expect from a hotel of this class. The rooms were quite small but well furnished and functional. The bathroom was very modern and again, very clean. Breakfast was basic but filling and included bread, cheese, meat, yogurts and pastries. If you are looking for an exceptionally good value for money hotel in a central location then I would not hesitate in recommending the Astoria Garden. The Termini area is ok but at night it was a bit like throwing out time at the pubs with a few oddballs lurking around the station. However, we did not feel threatened or unsafe at all as there were plenty of other 'normal' people around at the same time! Rome is a beautiful city. We had fabulous weather and a lot of the attractions were fairly quiet. I would go during the low season as I can imagine it being very busy during summer. Don't miss St Peters, Sistine Chapel, The Vatican Museums (I recommend a guided tour around these 3 as there is so much to see) and the Colluseum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the sights”
Reviews.Author: stewyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: An excellent small hotel in a location near the bus and rail stations. The staff are most helpful, the hotel is clean and is situated near some good restaurants. We were able to walk to all the main tourist sites and would certainly stay there again. S. Melrose

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: willbb1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel's best feature is it's location; it is perfect as a combination of conevnience for sightseeing and airport transfers. It is 5 min walk from the Termini station where the buses/metro/trams radiate from for sightseeing, and also where the Terravision or BusShuttle coach transfers drop/pickup. The hotel staff were very helpful, and attentive. The hotel is spotless, and the rooms are cleaned well on a daily basis. The ensuites are a little pokey, but they are new and immaculate. The room itself was of a reasonable size, and the bed was comfy. The TV was very small and attached high on the wall above the bed, so was hard to watch (but you don't come to Rome to watch TV!). The room got very cold at night and the aircon seemed to only have cold, or very cold as settings. If this had been different the room was perfect. The room is double-glazed so the very light traffic noise, and children outside the school opposite is never an issue. The hotel has an elevator, although I never felt 100% sure it was going to get us up to the second floor. It also has a really nice looking rear garden, which would've been lovely had it not been January/February!!! The breakfast was buffet style and basic. The juice was only a cordial type, and indicates the amount of thought going into the 'free breakfast'. The area around Termini to the north is full or restaurants, and delis for eating and shopping. There is even a fairly inexpensive supermarket about 75 metres from the hotel if you want to stock up on souvenirs on the cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: julcull
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome . Awesome place although not the cheapest. The hotel was convenient to station where the coach dropped us off . We walked everywhere including the Vatican . Hotel was small and clean . Bathroom very clean and modern , bedroom small but clean although desperately needs new carpet as it looked as if it had been damaged by water. Noticed in another room as well when the door was open. I found the staff Ok . Would recommend for the money . Nice bar and restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Very Good Room”
Reviews.Author: feelcurious
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are budget travelers. We'd rather spend less on accomodations because on ANY trip, it is more important to us to explore what a location has to offer, than to spend time in a hotel room. I did a lot of hotel searching for weeks... scouring through at least a hundred, before settling on the Astoria Garden. I checked hotels, and even private apartments that are rented weekly. With that said, we have a few basic requirements; Gotta have a private bathroom, and would like to have breakfast included with the room. I read reviews here at TripAdvisor till I was bleary-eyed; I learned that a European breakfast is what we Americans might consider to be a light snack... So my goal was to find a cheap room, near the sights, with a reasonable breakfast. The Astoria Garden met that, and much more! It was one of the few places (from the reviews I read) that actually includes meat and cheese with their breakfast. There is no limit to how much you eat, it is all self-serve, mostly cereal, coffee, juice, bread, pastry, and fruit... no eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, pancakes... I would have several cups of coffee and a couple of ham & cheese sandwhiches on Italian bread to start my day, which was just fine by me. Unlike several other reviews here: I found our room to be quite large. It was the room nearest the front desk, on the first floor. With a 10-foot ceiling, the bed (I think) was queen size... plus a chair that opened into a cot with mattress, that we used for our 4 month old daughter to sleep on. We paid $89 US/night through Expedia for a 6-night stay from Nov 11-17 2006. Bathroom was very nice, with a corner shower and plenty of clean towels replaced daily. Desk staff were excellent, and very helpful... even though I speak no Italian, and some of them did not speak much English. They even arranged a babysitter for us (to watch our daughter, in our room), while we went on the Vatican Scavi Tour, which absolutely forbids children under 15 yrs of age. Astoria Garden is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Coliseum... and is probably within walking distance of most of the major sites. We did not feel unsafe at any time, day or night, walking around the area. The Termini train station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and the DaVinci express train will take you to and from the airport, for about 11 euros per person, each way. Other trains can take you to within walking distance of just about any Rome location, including the Vatican. Several of the hop-on, hop-off, tour buses also begin and end their tours at the Termini station. It is THE central transportation hub in Rome, and well worth being close to... We are both very fit, but after walking around the city the first day, we were glad to be near the Termini, and just grab a day pass for the train. Maybe I just lucked-out finding this place... maybe there is much better to be had for the money... I don't know... But if I stayed in Rome again, I would not hesitate to call Astoria Garden first!

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Astoria Garden in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MandarineBlossom
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to Termini station, but not too close, also another modern tube station - Castro Pretorio - available nearby, pretty good area, easy to get to the sightseeing places, walking distance from Colloseum. The room was small but very clean, except that it was smelling bleach the day of arrival, what brought me down in the beginning. Also no sunlight could get through as the curtains stayed fixed and not moving, but that was not a big deal in December when it turns dark so early and you turn the lights on anyway. Still later on everything turned OK. Especially enjoyed the bathroom which was spotless and modern with plenty of fresh towels of various sizes. Breakfast basic, but really delicious, no queues. Mandarine trees in the garden! Staff very friendly and welcoming, no problem at all. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location & value”
Reviews.Author: littlisthobo
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Astoria Garden Hotel earlier than check-in specified but the room was ready, staff were very helpful providing maps and directions etc. The room was small but exceptionally clean and well presented, bathroom was brand new and very clean with a very powerful shower and even a bidet which I wasn't expecting for a 'budget' hotel... (we paid £48 per room per night-excellent value) french doors looking out onto a very pretty garden, aircon/heating - all in all very pleasant for a 3* property. The hotel is about 3-5 min walk from the Termini Station (come out of the Termini front entrance opp. bus station, turn right pass Via Marsala on your right and it will be your second right after that down a quiet side street). The area is home to a lot of tramps and beggars and it was due to this that I insisted on getting a cab back to the Hotel rather than walk round the Termini at night. Other than that - highly recommended hotel and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: annden
Reviews.Content: A Tripadvisor member from Norfolk My wife & I have just returned after spending 4 nights sightseeing Rome and would validate everything regarding the previous positive reviews, except to say ''Yes, the beds were quite hard, at least in Room 111' and although the bathroom was modern and well appointed, the placing of the towel radiator made using the WC a little tricky trying to avoid ones' nether regions getting scorched !!! All in all though we would still recommend the hotel because the positives far outway the minor niggles.

Reviews.Title: “Astoria Garden Hotel just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Noel & Robyn
Reviews.Content: Noel & Robyn, Melbourne, Australia We have just returned from a six week trip to Europe. Our accommodation in Rome was at this "oasis" Hotel Astoria Garden. Having read a couple of negative reviews we were not confident. Were we pleasantly surprised! Room 110 - spacious, clean, kingsize bed, bedside tables (usually there are none, or maybe one) and a window which gave natural light. The bathroom was more than adequate; clean, with a shower you could actually move in! The hotel is conveniently situated close to Termini but not too close, walking distance though. There is a nice lounge, bar area which opens to a garden, in all a very inviting place. Antonio who is porter, barman, you name it, was a "gem" and the manager and desk staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast held in a very pleasant downstairs room was fresh and filling. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovly Stay”
Reviews.Author: PeteJN
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to help us have a great stay. The room was really nice, cleam, walm (It was very cold out!) and it was a great base to vist it a great city. The breakfast was enough to keep you fueled up for most of the day! I would reccomend this hotel as a very nice stay for a mid range budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the rail station and the bus tour companies. The staff where friendly and the rooms clean. The beds could have been more comfortable but where ok. There are repairs being done to the hotels exterior and the scaffolding makes the rooms darker. Over all I would recommend this hotel to families and individuals who want a clean and affordable place who understand that a three star hotel means that it wont be the Ritz! We enjoyed our stay and would consider staying there again if on the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is conveniently located near the Termini rail station, we found little else to recommend it. The rooms and bathrooms are clean but crampted, noisy and uncomfortable. The airconditioner is either on full blast, aimed at the bed, or off; in which case one needs to open the window, which of course lets all the street noise in (even at the back facing the garden). The breakfast room is claustrophobic and the service is surly, at best. We have stayed at other 2 and 3 star hotels in Rome which were far more comfortable and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at this hotel. While the room was very compact, it was impeccably clean and well organized. Location near Termini is perfect and very quiet. However, what sets this hotel ahead of its competition is their super friendly staff. Overall it was a very positive experience and we would definitely come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Astoria Garden Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The doors were opened for us on arrival - not what we'd expected in this price bracket in central Rome. The welcome we recieved was very pleasing and the service was excellent. The interior was tasteful and simple. The garden room we stayed in was smaller than we anticipated but very clean and tastefully fitted. The bathroom was clean, modern with lots of towels and a powerful shower. The room was cleaned thoroughly each day with a change of towels. The Garden our door opened onto was a rustic treasure - Orange trees and a lemon 'bush' with quiet seating sheltered from the sun. The station was a leisurely five minutes walk away, if you want to take the underground, bus or taxi. The restaurants in the near vicinity were very welcoming and good value. A great base to explore Rome from! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Eurofile
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very enjoyable 5 night stay at the Hotel Astoria Garden in Rome and like most of the other Tripadvisor reviewers who have styed there, we loved the hotel. Although the hotel is small, it is immaculately maintained and beautifully decorated, with gleaming marble tiled floors, polished wood and bright pastel coloured walls in the public areas. The rooms are fairly compact but very comfortable and again, attractively decorated, immaculately maintained and spotlessly clean, as are the bathrooms. The hotel serves a good, plentiful, cold buffet breakfast with a choice of meats, cheese, bread, jams, cereals, yoghurts, fruit juice and coffee and teas, in a very pretty breakfast room. There is also a pleasant bar area and an attractive tropical courtyard garden to relax in. We found all the staff to be pleasant and helpful when needed, particularly Tony, the doorman/barman. The Astoria Garden is situated in a fairly quiet (compared to most of Rome) sidestreet and the double glazed windows cut out 99% of the street noise when closed. The efficient, remote controlled, air conditioning would mean that sleeping with the windows closed should not be a problem in the hotter summer months, although in March we did not have to use it. There are a number of good, reasonably priced Trattorias, Restuarants and Bars in the immediate neighbourhood and the hotel is conveniently placed for Termini train station, the metro and the main bus station. If, like us, you enjoy walking, then a number of Rome's major historical sites, including the Forum and the Colosseum, are within 20-30 minutes walking distance. We booked the Astoria Garden Hotel through needaroom.co.uk and at £54 per night for room and breakfast it was exceptional value. All in all, this is an excellent little gem of a hotel and I would not hestitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: tub
Reviews.Content: The Astoria Gardens is a must when stayling in Rome. Although the rooms are a little on the small side, they have everything that you need for a comfortable stay (including underfloor heating in the winter) The staff were most helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast was adequate, as you could eat as much as you liked. If you asked the staff where to eat at night they will tell you to go to Mamma Angelas, GO it is a great restaurant, and super value. It is also just around the corner. The Hotel is very close to the main metro/bus/rail station where everything seems to run very smoothly. We will certainly go back to the Astoria Gardens when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cosy though small”
Reviews.Author: Atarah-W
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews are all correct: small but spotlessly clean hotel generally. Breakfast repetitive: ham, cheese, jams, bread, cereal, yoghurts coffee/tea; no other meals available throughout day. Dining staff: 1 staff friendlier than the other lady. Desk staff courteous and helpful always. Doorman OK, not intrusive, unsmiling but professional. We were there for a special wedding anniversary which they were informed of beforehand as we wanted a good room - 1st night's room wasn't special so asked for an upgrade which manager was happy to do - 2nd room bit larger,1 seater chair, and usual furnitures - no fault found at all. Hotel close to restaurants from 3 mins to 10 mins walk. We tended to eat in the various parts of the City where we were sight seeing. Hotel close to many sights but Metro or bus from main transport centre - Termini, would take you in no time to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain. The Vatican - too far to walk to; Bus 40 from Termini 15 minutes 1 euro each way. We would recommend hotel to friends if requirement was for: small, no frills, clean hotel situated centrally, excellent location, quiet back street with nearby excellent transport services and i suppose affordable. All in all i would recommend Astoria.
